intro: Astracantha elazigensis, commonly known as the Elazığ thornvetch, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
